description: From Old French, from Latin aedificationem (“building, construction”), an accusative form of aedificatio, from aedificare.

entries.meaning: The act of edifying, or the state of being edified or improved; a building process, especially morally, emotionally, or spiritually
examples: It seems clear that he took great delight in his commonly perceived role as “the No 1 celebrity scientist”; huge audiences would attend his public lectures, perhaps not always just for scientific edification.
